WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic:
The construction radical and the construction kanji are the same!
This kanji also means industry, which is what construction is, if you think about it. It's all part of the construction industry.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Know your radicals and you'll know this kanji's meaning.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic:
For kanji that use the ã“ã† (there are a lot of them!) we will use the character ã“ã†ã„ã¡ every time. He's one of the people who started this website, so we'll do our best in the mnemonics to embarrass him as much as possible. Anyways, remember that whenever you see ã“ã†, think ã“ã†ã„ã¡.
You see some construction in front of you. There, standing shirtless (only a suspender and hard hat) is (ã“ã†ã„ã¡), looking back at you.
WaniKani_Reading_Info:
If ã“ã†ã„ã¡ as a construction worker standing in a construction site some how doesn't make your legs tremble, that's okay and totally normal. Do make sure you take this story to a ridiculous enough level to hook a memory into that brain of yours. Be mad at him for not following construction site regulations (where's his shirt, shoes, and pants!?). Why is he using that bulldozer like that?
Alternatively, say you really do like what you see (you're going to have to imagine a much better looking version of ã“ã†ã„ã¡'s actual face, though). You and ã“ã†ã„ã¡ make eye contact a little too long. He nods, puts his cigarette out, and takes off his hard hat, letting his long Fabio-esque locks flow. You beckon him over and he comes. What happens next is up to you and your own imagination. My guess is you have a very deep conversation about kanji and the best ways to learn it.
Hint: When you see å·¥ in a kanji it will often take the ã“ã† reading. Remember that, because it comes up quite a bit!

The lower part of the inscriptions on the early inscriptions is thicker, which resembles the blade of the " king " like the axe. The original meaning is a tool with a blade, and its upper part may have the function of " moment " (curved ruler) (Ji Xusheng). The extension is merit and skill (Zhang Risheng).

Yang Shuda thinks that " work " is like a curved ruler based on the " moment " like a person holding " work ". Zou Jingheng and Liu Xinmin think that " work " is like a construction tool.

Individuals who do not own the means of production and rely on wages for their livelihood: workers. Working class. Workers and Peasants Union.

Workload: remember work. This project requires thirty workers.

Good at, good at: work, calligraphy and painting. Scheming. ch?)] An ancient Chinese notation symbol system, with ten characters: He, Si, Yi, Shang, Chi, Gong, Fan, Six, Five, B, which is equivalent to 5671234567 in numbered musical notation. "Work" is equivalent to "3".

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[â‘ ]ï¼»gÅngï¼½
["Ji Yun" Gu Hongqie, Pingdong, see you. ]
(1) Tools. A kind of curved ruler.
(2) Clever; fine.
(3) Good at; good at.
(4) Officials; ministry.
(5) The general term for laborers engaged in various skills in ancient times. "The Analects of Confucius Wei Linggong": "Workers must first sharpen their tools if they want to be good at their work." "MenciusÂ·Teng Wengong 2": "The former Zhao Jianzi made Wang Liang and Wu a baby, all day without a bird. Xi Fanming said:'The world is cheap.'" Liang Liuxie of the Southern Dynasties, "Wen Xin Diao Long Â· Original Dao": "Yunxia carved color, there is more than painting skills." Modern abbreviation for workers and working class.
(6) In ancient times, it specifically refers to music officials.
(7) In ancient times, it specifically refers to female workers.
(8) Time; technology.
(9) Construction site; job position.
(10) Engineering.
(11) Industry.
(12) Work; productive labor.
(13) Workload; the work of a worker or farmer for one working day.
(14) One of the musical names in Gongchi score.
(15) Through "Gong".
(16) Through "attack". Sturdy.
(17) Through "attack". Engage in; learn.
(18) Last name. There were Gonglidan in the Han Dynasty.

Meaning Mnemonic
The construction radical and the construction kanji are the same!
This kanji also means industry, which is what construction is, if you think about it. It's all part of the construction industry.
Know your radicals and you'll know this kanji's meaning.
